description: Pen-Based Recognition of Handwritten Digits dataset. Contains coordinate information from pen trajectories captured while writing digits 0-9 on a pressure-sensitive tablet. The data represents the dynamic movement of pen strokes rather than static images.
creator: E. Alpaydin, F. Alimoglu (Bogazici University, Turkey)
feature_description: 16 features representing 8 (x,y) coordinate pairs sampled along the pen trajectory. Features are resampled spatially at regular arc-length intervals rather than temporal intervals for better alignment.

data_collection.resampling: Spatial resampling to 8 points using linear interpolation

use_case: Online handwriting recognition for pen-based interfaces, digital signature verification, tablet input systems, and educational applications
dynamic_vs_static: Unlike static digit recognition, this dataset captures the temporal dynamics of writing, including stroke order and velocity information
reported_accuracy: k-NN achieves 97.74% accuracy with k=1 using Euclidean distance
experimental_notes: Spatial resampling (T=8 points) provided best trade-off between accuracy and complexity compared to T=12 or T=16
ethical_considerations: Dataset may reflect writing styles specific to the participant pool and may not generalize across different cultures or writing systems
